name: Chipping Challenge
description:
Chipping Challenge is a point-and-click meditative golf-like game meant to be relaxing and rewarding. It started as a riff on the excellent Desert Golf and sequel Golf on Mars.  It has really chill sound and equally smooth visual effects.

Chipping Challenge is a game where failure is punished only in the mechanical sense, and is rewarded visually. Particle effects float in the air when the ball hits the ground and the player has a persistent, swooshing, trail. Similar but less lasting effects occur when the player completes a challenge (putting the ball in the hole).

Controls
  • Click or tap and drag to shoot the ball
  • Right-click cancels aiming 
  • Command+F = toggle full screen / windowed
  • Escape = Quit
Credits

Game assembled by Phil Nelson, an independent engineer and media producer.

Thanks to beta testers John Inacay, Charles Nelson, Derek Lipkin, and Henry Nelson.

The music is Ambient Universe.

This game is based on the Endless Golf unity asset.
